User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Git State Restorer application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

failedLoginAttempts.description: Number of failed login attempts. Can be used for rate limiting or account lockout.

lastLoginAttempt.description: Timestamp of the last login attempt.

isLocked.description: Indicates whether the user account is locked due to too many failed login attempts.

lockoutExpiryTime.description: The timestamp when the user lockout will expire.

definition.description: Stores user data. Access is restricted to the authenticated user.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique ID of the user, matching the Firebase Authentication UID.

firestore.reasoning: This Firestore structure prioritizes security and scalability for the Git State Restorer application, focusing on user authentication issues. It uses path-based ownership for user data and aims to support simple, robust security rules. Authorization Independence is achieved by avoiding `get()` calls in rules, relying solely on `request.auth.uid` and existence checks. The data structure also segregates user data, ensuring a homogeneous security posture within each collection. Specifically: The user document stores data for login, authentication, and rate limiting. Storing authentication-related details directly in the database could be beneficial for auditing or support. The design assumes all user-related data is private and accessible only to the user themselves. The path `/users/{userId}` provides a secure, path-based ownership model. The absence of collaborative features simplifies the authorization model, as access is primarily based on user identity.
